str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
Probably from the same as pale; anew, i.e. back, once more, or furthermore or on the other hand.
When, whenever. From hote and an; whenever; also causatively inasmuch as.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To lead in, bring in, introduce. From eis and ago; to introduce.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
First-born, eldest. From protos and the alternate of tikto; first-born.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Feminine participle present passive of oikeo; land, i.e. The globe; specially, the Roman empire.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
From aggello; a messenger; especially an 'angel'; by implication, a pastor.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From pros and a probable derivative of kuon; to fawn or crouch to, i.e. prostrate oneself in homage.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
